overview_of_class: A course to introduce freshmen and sophomores to the field of Biomedical Engineering. This is a zero-credit required course for the BS in BME. It should be taken by students in their freshman year. In discussion style format, we will discuss topics important for helping you decide if BME is the right major for you and making the most of your undergraduate experience. There is one partner-based assignment where you will interview two people working in the BME field. To get a satisfactory grade in this course, you must attend 8 (out of 9) classes and complete the assignment.
name: Introduction to Biomedical Engineering
title: MEAS BMD_ENG 101-0-20 Introduction to Biomedical Engineering

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Is BME the major for you? The field of biomedical engineering
Preparing for careers in biomedical engineering
The BME curriculum
Special academic opportunities to consider
Becoming involved in research
Cooperative education and internships
Pre-health professions advice
Biomedical engineering ethics

subject: BMD_ENG
